input: Rebellious subjects, enemies to peace,
response: Profaners of this neighbour-stained steel,--

input: Profaners of this neighbour-stained steel,--
response: Will they not hear? What, ho! you men, you beasts,

input: Will they not hear? What, ho! you men, you beasts,
response: That quench the fire of your pernicious rage

input: That quench the fire of your pernicious rage
response: With purple fountains issuing from your veins,

input: With purple fountains issuing from your veins,
response: On pain of torture, from those bloody hands

input: On pain of torture, from those bloody hands
response: Throw your mistemper'd weapons to the ground,

input: Throw your mistemper'd weapons to the ground,
response: And hear the sentence of your moved prince.

input: And hear the sentence of your moved prince.
response: Three civil brawls, bred of an airy word,

input: Three civil brawls, bred of an airy word,
response: By thee, old Capulet, and Montague,

input: By thee, old Capulet, and Montague,
response: Have thrice disturb'd the quiet of our streets,

input: Have thrice disturb'd the quiet of our streets,
response: And made Verona's ancient citizens

input: And made Verona's ancient citizens
response: Cast by their grave beseeming ornaments,

input: Cast by their grave beseeming ornaments,
response: To wield old partisans, in hands as old,

input: To wield old partisans, in hands as old,
response: Canker'd with peace, to part your canker'd hate:

input: Canker'd with peace, to part your canker'd hate:
response: If ever you disturb our streets again,

input: If ever you disturb our streets again,
response: Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.

input: Your lives shall pay the forfeit of the peace.
response: For this time, all the rest depart away:

input: For this time, all the rest depart away:
response: You Capulet; shall go along with me:

input: You Capulet; shall go along with me:
response: And, Montague, come you this afternoon,

input: And, Montague, come you this afternoon,
response: To know our further pleasure in this case,

input: To know our further pleasure in this case,
response: To old Free-town, our common judgment-place.

input: To old Free-town, our common judgment-place.
response: Once more, on pain of death, all men depart.

input: Once more, on pain of death, all men depart.
response: Exeunt all but MONTAGUE, LADY MONTAGUE, and BENVOLIO

input: Exeunt all but MONTAGUE, LADY MONTAGUE, and BENVOLIO
response: Where are the vile beginners of this fray?

input: Where are the vile beginners of this fray?
response: Benvolio, who began this bloody fray?

input: Benvolio, who began this bloody fray?
response: Romeo slew him, he slew Mercutio;

input: Romeo slew him, he slew Mercutio;
response: Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe?

input: Who now the price of his dear blood doth owe?
response: And for that offence

input: And for that offence
response: Immediately we do exile him hence:

input: Immediately we do exile him hence:
response: I have an interest in your hate's proceeding,

input: I have an interest in your hate's proceeding,
response: My blood for your rude brawls doth lie a-bleeding;

input: My blood for your rude brawls doth lie a-bleeding;
response: But I'll amerce you with so strong a fine

input: But I'll amerce you with so strong a fine
response: That you shall all repent the loss of mine:

input: That you shall all repent the loss of mine:
response: I will be deaf to pleading and excuses;

input: I will be deaf to pleading and excuses;
response: Nor tears nor prayers shall purchase out abuses:

input: Nor tears nor prayers shall purchase out abuses:
response: Therefore use none: let Romeo hence in haste,

input: Therefore use none: let Romeo hence in haste,
response: Else, when he's found, that hour is his last.

input: Else, when he's found, that hour is his last.
response: Bear hence this body and attend our will:

input: Bear hence this body and attend our will:
response: Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.

input: Mercy but murders, pardoning those that kill.
response: Exeunt

input: Exeunt
response: SCENE II. Capulet's orchard.

input: SCENE II. Capulet's orchard.
response: Enter JULIET

input: Enter JULIET
response: What misadventure is so early up,

input: What misadventure is so early up,
response: That calls our person from our morning's rest?

input: That calls our person from our morning's rest?
response: Enter CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, and others

input: Enter CAPULET, LADY CAPULET, and others
response: What fear is this which startles in our ears?

input: What fear is this which startles in our ears?
response: First Watchman

input: First Watchman
response: Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain;

input: Sovereign, here lies the County Paris slain;
response: And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before,

input: And Romeo dead; and Juliet, dead before,
response: Warm and new kill'd.

input: Warm and new kill'd.
response: Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes.

input: Search, seek, and know how this foul murder comes.
response: First Watchman

input: First Watchman
response: Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man;

input: Here is a friar, and slaughter'd Romeo's man;
response: With instruments upon them, fit to open

input: With instruments upon them, fit to open
response: These dead men's tombs.

input: These dead men's tombs.
response: Come, Montague; for thou art early up,

input: Come, Montague; for thou art early up,
response: To see thy son and heir more early down.

input: To see thy son and heir more early down.
response: Look, and thou shalt see.

input: Look, and thou shalt see.
response: Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while,

input: Seal up the mouth of outrage for a while,
response: Till we can clear these ambiguities,

input: Till we can clear these ambiguities,
response: And know their spring, their head, their

input: And know their spring, their head, their
response: true descent;

input: true descent;
response: And then will I be general of your woes,

input: And then will I be general of your woes,
response: And lead you even to death: meantime forbear,

input: And lead you even to death: meantime forbear,
response: And let mischance be slave to patience.

input: And let mischance be slave to patience.
response: Bring forth the parties of suspicion.

input: Bring forth the parties of suspicion.
response: Then say at once what thou dost know in this.

input: Then say at once what thou dost know in this.
response: We still have known thee for a holy man.

input: We still have known thee for a holy man.
response: Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?

input: Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?
response: Give me the letter; I will look on it.

input: Give me the letter; I will look on it.
response: Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?

input: Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?
response: Sirrah, what made your master in this place?

input: Sirrah, what made your master in this place?
response: This letter doth make good the friar's words,

input: This letter doth make good the friar's words,
response: Their course of love, the tidings of her death:

input: Their course of love, the tidings of her death:
response: And here he writes that he did buy a poison

input: And here he writes that he did buy a poison
response: Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal

input: Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal
response: Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.

input: Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.
response: Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!

input: Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!
response: See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,

input: See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,
response: That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.

input: That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.
response: And I for winking at your discords too

input: And I for winking at your discords too
response: Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.

input: Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.
response: A glooming peace this morning with it brings;

input: A glooming peace this morning with it brings;
response: The sun, for sorrow, will not show his head:

input: The sun, for sorrow, will not show his head:
response: Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things;

input: Go hence, to have more talk of these sad things;
response: Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished:

input: Some shall be pardon'd, and some punished:
response: For never was a story of more woe

input: For never was a story of more woe
response: Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.

input: Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.
response: Exeunt
